intro: Panderia divaricata, commonly known as the star anise plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which is used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The plant belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is known for its aromatic properties. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. The fruit develops in clusters and is harvested when it turns dark brown, indicating maturity.
